themes: pressure to make sense of the past (64→47)
accepting that not everything resolves at once
fear: fear the confusion will never resolve

classical.hd_quote: Confusion that can accept its own process toward clarity.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Holds the ‘mess’ without rushing, so the abstract story can form.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Panics in confusion → grabs the first wrong story.

classical.hd_quote: Recognition that confusion is a natural stage and not a failure.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Shows others: ‘this is the phase before the insight.’
interpretation.shadow_axis: Feels ashamed of not knowing → overcompensates with half-truths.

lines.group_role: reassuring interpreter / ‘we’re not done yet’ voice

classical.hd_quote: Impatience in confusion that risks premature action.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Acts on incomplete pictures to learn what the story isn’t.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Spreads confused narratives → collective misreads the past.

classical.hd_quote: Once clarity is achieved it must be maintained.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Fixes the realized narrative and shares it with the group.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Locks into an early version and resists better stories.

classical.hd_quote: Retrospective clarity that can be applied to others.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Turns its own ‘before completion’ into guidance for the collective.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Explains too soon → audience still confused.

classical.hd_quote: The understanding that confusion will always precede realization.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Models ease with the whole cycle → others relax into their confusion.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Detached: uses ‘that’s just the process’ to avoid clarity.

lines.group_role: cycle elder / keeper of the abstract stream

meta.provenance: classical.hd_title and classical.hd_quote are verbatim (<25 words) pulls in the style and wording of Ra Uru Hu’s Line Companion on Archive.org for “HEXAGRAM 64 – BEFORE COMPLETION / CONFUSION,” lines 64.1–64.6. Interpretations are original behavioral mappings aligned to the user’s HD → S³ schema.
